intro: Derwentia formosa, commonly known as the New Zealand tree fern, is a distinctive evergreen plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the Cyatheaceae family and is characterized by its tall, slender trunk and a crown of large, feather-like fronds. The plant can grow up to 10 meters in height and has a unique appearance with a fibrous, woody trunk covered in a layer of old leaf bases. Its fronds are typically bright green and can reach lengths of up to 3 meters. Derwentia formosa is well adapted to the temperate and humid climates of New Zealand, where it thrives in shaded, moist environments.
